commit_list.message:
test: Add timeouts to methods that could wait forever in test/integration/fake_upstream.h. (#3936)

Signed-off-by: Michael Behr <mkbehr@google.com>

test: Add timeouts to methods that could wait forever in test/integration/fake_upstream.h. (#3936)

Signed-off-by: Michael Behr <mkbehr@google.com>

this is stupid

I left my git password on my other computer so I have to put the pbw here

Initial imiplementation of expansion RAM banks

no functionality for saving them to disk, though
Correctly interpret volume control for custom wave

Mixer volume register

Nothing for Vin, but apparently nobody ever used Vin.

Sound debugging

Includes a mysterious factor of 4 in the period function. Don't know
why it's there, but it sounds like it's in the right octave now.

Add a tile-viewer window with --display-tiles

The GL code is kind of hacked together but it works for now
do not scream when we play tetris
Don't press all buttons at all times
Don't update the screen if it's disabled
Debugger command to print CPU interrupt state
Add debugger command to disassemble a function
Add --debug flag to start debugger immediately

Change cmakelists to use clang

On OS X we use it anyway

Draw the screen every frame

This is a big slowdown, but it works!

Implement MBC1

Structure is a bit of a hack

On the other hand, we now pass the combined cpu test file.

Implement timers and halt

We now pass all individual tests in the cpu_instrs suite.

Interrupts

Test 2 now fails on timer subtest

Fix CB prefix bugs

Now passes all tests except instruction test

Test and fix DAA

Now passes all of test 1, DAA in test 11

Test and fix sbc

Now passes test 4 and the SBC instructions on tests 9, 11

Fix flags when adding to stack (opcodes e8, f8)

Test 3 now passes

Opcode fixes and misc. testing

Current results on test suite:

01-special: fail DAA
02-interrupts: fail EI
03-op sp,hl: fail ADD SP,r8 and LD HL,SP+r8
04-op r,imm: fail SBC A,d8
05-op rp: pass
06-ld r,r: pass
07-jr,jp,call,ret,rst: pass
08-misc instrs: pass
09-op r,r: fail various SBC, RLC, RRC, RL, RR, SLA, SRA, SWAP, SRL
10-bit ops: pass
11-op a,(hl): fail SBC, RLC, RRC, RL, RR, SLA, SRA, SWAP, SRL, DAA(?)
Test flag C for CALL C and CALL NC

Monitor the link port and print outgoing values

(bypassing the actual control register and just writing everything that
goes into the data register)
Make SUB, SBC, and CP properly set flag Z
Main file full of messy testing
Fix stack order; inline functions for CALL/RET
Fix argument/operation bits for 0x80 op family
JR: jump relative to start of next opcode
Change opcodes to use new memory access

Start read/write functions for memory access

Instead of just raw pointers. Not sure this is the best possible
architecture, but it'll work.
Print CB-prefix opcode names, fix their lengths
Make the CPU run instructions from a file

Implement CBxx opcodes

This should complete the opcode implementation, though a few opcodes
point to unimplemented functions in the cpu

Finish first half of opcodes

CPU will complain when we try STOP or HALT, but it's no longer the
opcode dispatcher's problem.

Initial memory implementation

update opcodes to properly point to memory when necessary

Implement opcodes [0-3][9-f]

Skipped 08, 18, 28, and 38 for now
Define second quarter of opcode table
Start defining CPU, summarize opcode table

Emulate PPUADDR's effect on nametable base bits

Super Mario Bros. now plays correctly without hacks.

Remove mario raster hacks, properly update regions

SMB almost works now - only problem is a strange flickering of the
status bar when the horizontal nametable base bit is set.

Fix crash with more than one scroll region

Super Mario Bros. now displays the status bar correctly if I manually
hack in an appropriate scrolling change.

Overhaul rendering to prepare for raster effects

Background rendering now divides the screen into a series of scroll
regions, each of which can display the background according to a
different set of scroll coordinates. Currently it doesn't use more than
one scroll region, but the functionality is there.
Add debug function to print a tile representation

Implement smooth scrolling

However, scroll coordinates cannot yet change during a frame.
Remove dead cacheing code and numpy imports

Add cheat interface

this helped me confirm that Super Mario Bros. is currently beatable

Hack together scrolling for Super Mario Bros.

Game is probably 100% beatable now.
Specify ppu debug output via command-line flag

Implement vertical mirroring for NROM mapper

This temporarily breaks Super Mario Bros.
Allow command-line flags and disabling audio

Re-implement sprite 0 hit detection, test on SMB

Super Mario Bros. now runs at full speed and can be played, though the
background doesn't scroll and there are sound glitches
Respect PPUMASK flags for hiding bkg/sprites
Tie APU frame counter to actual CPU cycles

Synchronize some pulse clocks when FC updated

Unfortunately, this doesn't seem to fix the bug with mario's footsteps.

Let APU frame counter mode change, synchronize

This fixes the high-pitched tone when enabling the triangle channel in
donkey kong. (Pulse channels don't currently synchronize because they
don't simulate the frame counter as closely, so there might still be
problems with them.)

Implement triangle wave channel

Makes a brief high-pitched tone when donkey kong first turns it on, but
otherwise seems to work correctly

Add pulse wave duration and sweep unit

The sweep unit doesn't really sound right yet, but it's a start.
Add phase/volume reset, track pulse divider in c++
Silence pulse waves below the minimum period
Change PulseWave to use portaudio instead of stk
Let pulse duty change, shift wave by 1/8 period

Add second pulse channel

The opening jingle sounds okay, though it's missing some features. The
in-game music is a bizarre hellscape.

Connect emulator to audio output code

Currently this will just play from the second pulse wave channel.

Fix background rendering and remove boost code

ttants: float, unsigned char

Start replacing boost.python with ctypes

Boost.Python doesn't work with pypy, and ctypes does.

Something's broken here, and this just puts out confusing garbage. But
it's confusing garbage at 60 frames per second!

Fix palette problems

the glsl uint type is a lie

More graphics work

Background displays almost correctly now, except for some palette
problems.
Interface with Boost.Python; build with CMake
Put background vertices in the right places

More C++ conversion.

Now it can do a test render loop using the shaders (though the shaders
don't get any interesting data to draw)
Start rewriting GL interface code in c++
Start trying to use a GPU thread

Stop trying to frame-limit

it causes segfaults somehow and we're not actually running that fast
Smoothed average FPS, start frame limiting

FPS counter in window title

also name project Missingnes

Draw sprites

transparency doesn't work yet

Load the sprite ptab without breaking everything

I've discovered the order of opengl incantations that I need to make
this work but I don't understand them
Make vertex shader take pixel coordinates for x,y
Don't set all the bg vertex values every frame

Finish atlas texture

we can now display the palette table!

Turn everything into floats

we can now draw a screen full of 0s
Properly draw to cover the whole screen
Make GL draw something to the screen
Make GL code run without crashing
Start work on a single texture for the bg ptab

Successfully render the tile at (4,4).

(And now we need to change the entire structure.)
Start rendering things in opengl directly
Don't make pyglet textures in ppu cache
Switching to PyOpenGL: get OpenGL >= 3.2 context

Start calling opengl stuff myself (doesn't work)

This is before I switch to pyopengl.
Speed up sprite manipulation a little
Draw sprites with their palettes, not the bg's
Draw faster sprites, but with buggy palettes

Start caching sprites

buggy, very slow so far

PPU $3f10/$3f14/$3f18/$3f1c mirror $10 down

This makes the sky blue in Super Mario Bros.
Fix where attribute tables assign their palettes

Read background attribute tables

There's a glitch here somehow, but most of the background is correctly
colored
Use PIL palette mode for faster coloring
Fix bug reading instructions from non-ROM memory

Implement controller input from keyboard

Donkey Kong is playable! :D

Begin controller input.

Right now we have some predefined input: always hold right; press start
on frame 5. As expected, the game starts and mario runs to the right
until he hits the edge of the platform, then stands there forever.

Partial sprite fixes

half-fix vertical alignment problem, attempt to respect mirroring

First shot at drawing sprites

We can draw sprites! There are a few problems - we need to respect
properties like horizontal mirroring or mario will look weird, and
there's some sort of vertical alignment bug. There's a slight fps drop
from this. Most of it comes from iterating through all the sprites on
the scanline for every pixel, and a bit of it comes from disabling the
background caching we had earlier.

Fix PPU cycles per CPU cycle

There are three PPU cycles per one CPU cycle, not one PPU cycle per
three CPU cycles.

Cache background tiles

Doesn't actually seem to speed things up yet. Not sure why.

Optimize ROR instruction

We wasted time checking to see whether we were using implicit addressing
instead of just calling different functions depending on our addressing
mode. There should be comparable per-instruction speedup to be had by
giving the same treatment to other operations, but donkey kong uses this
one way more.
Don't load the same bkg byte eight times
Store screen in ppu as a numpy array

Make screen appear under pypy

use test.pillowscreen method

Track instruction cycle counts (mostly)

Unimplemented cycle count modifiers:
- When izy, abx, and aby cross a page boundary, they should take one
  extra cycle
- When rel (always a branch) branches, it should take one extra
  cycle. If it branches to a new page, two extra cycles. (Not sure
  whether that's two or three extra total.)

Make the whole title screen display

before, it was only displaying one row out of every 8
Fix ROL and ROR to properly interact with carry
Give MMC1 back its PRG RAM
Make PHP set the expansion flag on the stack
Get individual instruction test roms to run
Set up apparatus to print messages from instr_test
Replace a bunch of errors with warnings
More PPU work. Can render a bunch of 0s!
Add new instruction test (doesn't run yet)
Debug CMP, RTI, and indirect addressing.

Fix relative addressing

Have to add 2 to the result because of how the hardware's program
counter interacts with actually executing the instruction.
BRK and RTI. All instructions are in.
Implement stack push/pop; fix JSR and RTS
Zero page addressing, RAM writing, STA/X/Y
Start implementing RAM and proper memory mapping
Don't pretend to have 64-bit registers on our NES
I can execute the JMP instruction at C000!
Start coding for opcodes to do things
Add standard nestest log for comparison
Disassemble all address modes, add more opcodes
More opcodes, test disassembling several opcodes

Add function to dereference a pointer from memory.

We can now dereference the pointer at VEC_RST to find the place where we
start.
Update disassembly to start at C000
Add rudimentary memory addressing for PRG ROM
